identification.fruiting_body: Round or cushion-shaped to pear-shaped flattened, 0.4-2.0 inches wide, 0.8-1.6 inches high, short tapering stalk, white with densely packed short spines peeling in patches, thin papery inner skin granular brown to olive-brown, small apical pore.
identification.gleba: White firm immature, greenish-brown, greyish-brown powdery mature, sterile base whitish to brownish.
identification.microscopic: Spores globose 3.5-4.5 µm minutely warted nearly smooth olive-yellow in KOH; capillitial threads yellowish to olive in KOH 2-7 µm wide pitted walls 0.5-1 µm thick branched occasionally no color change.

habitat: Saprobic, ground singly or groups, nutrient-poor sandy soils, oak-pine woodlands, roadsides, urban, conifers and hardwoods, summer to winter (June-December), Europe, North America, South America, Australia.
